articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
I’m a physician, educator, and researcher.
Education
I graduated Medicine from Ben-Gurion University, Israel; completed my Master of Health Administration cum laude from Bar-Ilan University, Israel.
Research experience
I have published over 20 scientific articles, received grants totaling 400K NIS + 40K USD, served as a reviewer for four journals, mentored MD students, and wrote a book chapter.
Professional experience
I started volunteering as a first responder in Magen David Adom, Israel. During my studies, I worked as a physician assistant in internal medicine. Later, I served as the director of physician assistants in Soroka Medical Center, Israel, where I also did my internship. Currently, I’m a resident in internal medicine in Sheba Tel-Hashomer Medical Center, Israel
Teaching experience
I taught physics at Ben-Gurion University, Israel to biology, pharmacy, nursing, and medical students for over eight years. Later, I taught leadership and tactical medicine to paramedics and physicians. Currently, I teach medical students internal medicine and R for biomedical research.
Awards
In 2013-2014 I won twice the Best Speaker award of the Israeli National Debating Championship. In 2014 I also won an Intern’s Award of Excellence from Soroka Medical Center, Israel. In 2017, I won an Award of Excellence from the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces. In 2019, an assay I first-authored won a creative writing contest by the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces. In 2020, my team won a Medical Data Science Hackathon for the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps.
Research interests
My main research interest is cardiology. However, I love to clean and wrangle data of all sorts so you can find my name on publications in tactical medicine, rheumatology, endocrinology, and even obstetrics.
Personal

I’m married to Miriam and a father to Barack.
